intro: Pisum sativum var. persistens, commonly known as the evergreen pea, is a variant of the common pea that retains its foliage throughout the year. This plant is characterized by its bushy growth habit and the ability to produce flowers and pods even in colder conditions. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has trifoliate leaves with stipules. The flowers are usually white or pale purple, and the pods contain several seeds. This variety is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its persistent foliage and long blooming period.
